alert.note: Alert for Spencer (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 8:08PM EDT until September 04 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Indiana, including the following county, Spencer. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 704 PM CDT, While Doppler radar indicated the heaviest rain has come to an end, minor flooding remains possible in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3.5 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible over the area. This additional rain may contribute to minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rockport, Dale, Grandview, Santa Claus, Eureka, Chrisney and Gentryville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
